alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of western Caribou, northwestern Bannock, central Power, northwestern Bonneville and central Bingham Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Hall Eagle Lodge, or near Blackfoot, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Blackfoot, American Falls, American Falls Reservoir, Neeley, Goshen, Chubbuck, Shelley, Aberdeen, Inkom, Firth, Rose, Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge, Pingree, Pocatello Airport, Fort Hall Putnam Lodge, Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge, Fort Hall Eagle Lodge and Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Upper Snake River Plain
